title: How do I counter the Yi + Kayle strategy?
body:
I admit I just lost to one, thougth it would be easy, but holy shit, I got stomped.

For those who don't know, here is how it works. Jungler goes with Yi, top laner goes with Kayle (with {{summoner:4}} {{summoner:7}} as summoner spells and Windspeaker's Blessing as a keystone). Yi jungles as normal, Kayle farms top until she buys an {{item:3504}}. She is free to play passive because this item is very cheap and she doesn't need a lot of farm to buy it. After Yi gets one item, Kayle and Yi proceed to push top and take out all towers. Yi can dive the enemy freely because of Kayle's ult and heal. Kayle proceeds to buy support items like {{item:3109}} and just protects Yi all game. It gets worse if they have another enchanter support like {{champion:117}} or {{champion:25}} because then it is literally impossible to stop Yi.

I admit I don't know how to counter this. Some say I should need to tell my jungler to camp bot and/or mid and snowball those lanes. The problem is that not everytime my team has the coordination to do that. And I admit I don't know how to stop it on my own. Can someone help me?

Howdy. Kayle OTP here, with around 2.7 Million points on her, and peaked around masters norms mmr and diamond 3. This is my "Name" account, with Name / Tag / etc. (Kind of like Shakarez / Kayle bot) (I also happen to be unofficial head mod on the reddit / discord owner)

Kayle is one of the few "problem" champions in this game. Not in the sense that she's "broken," but in her versatility and numbers. Her kit doesn't interact in a way that can actually "outplay" other champions, but functions as a mid game monster with the strengths and weaknesses of both Mages and Marksmen. She's a champion with a lot of weaknesses, and she's balanced around her one tricks. Kayle, Like aurelion sol, has a very wide difference between newer players and experienced players. 

Now, when talking about her balance Kayle isn't a champion that riot directly nerfs. Kayle is a champion that exists around Mage / Marksman / and Supportive itemization. When an item under this list is disproportionately too strong, Kayle takes the item and turns it on it's head and amplifies the reach of said item. Basically, in the support role enchanters are extremely strong right now because of their items. If you're going to take this strategy down, It's not Kayle that needs to get hit (because they'll have to buff something on her) but items.

Exactly. Go into the Kayle mains discord and subreddit and you'll find most of us are small in numbers but know virtually everything about her. What build paths to take, what matchups are wins, what skin is the best (Aether Wing). She's a rare pick and the main way she seems OP is if she scales into late when her early game is trash compared to so many other laners.

{{champion:10}}  is rushing {{item:3504}} and has Windspeaker's Blessing so she is absolutely useless without {{champion:11}}. Kill her before he comes top. 

The real problem is that people rarely take the time to shut down {{champion:11}}. If he has no damage he can't do anything, invulnerable or not. {{champion:11}} does not snowball, he avalanches, especially when he, melee ADC, has a support. Once he gets going you aren't going to stop him.

The two will also rarely team fight so sending someone with wave clear to hold top can work. Fight the 4 v 3 mid and push. Yi and Kayle might get a tower or two but if you can beat them to the inhibitor you've won.

SIDE NOTE: This strategy is not exclusive to {{champion:10}} + {{champion:11}}. Other possible top laners include {{champion:117}}{{champion:25}}{{champion:26}} while other possible junglers include {{champion:24}}{{champion:23}}{{champion:5}}.

Why would KAYLE rush a fucking Censor?
That's the point of the entire strategy, for Kayle to be a heal bot for Yi

Unless it's Kayle support, there is NO context where Kayle should be a heal bot for Yi...or ANYONE. Kayle should be a complimentary late game carry *along with* Yi, with her ult and heal on him or her depending on who needs it more.

No, that's the entire point of the strategy. She IS a support. She will buy items like {{item:3504}} {{item:3109}} and other things for the sole purpose of supporting Yi. That is her job when someone is doing this. For her to be a carry, she would have to farm up and be getting kills to get the gold she needs for offensive items, which would lower her capability to support him. That would also make Yi gold starved, since he won't leave top for the strategy to work. If she tries to be a carry, the whole thing falls apart, Yi will be forced back into the jungle and other lanes to get gold, and it will just be a regular game that happens to have a Kayle and a Yi in it.

> [{quoted}](name=Valeckserai,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=A0Noaan2,comment-id=00100002000100000000,timestamp=2017-07-02T15:56:21.832+0000)
>
> No, that's the entire point of the strategy. 

It's not a strategy. It's a Brofresco quality gimmick.

Kayle's R is the strongest supportive aspect about her and it has no scalings. The only other thing she has is a speed up + heal on W, ranged damage on E, and a damage + slow Q. Q is better with larger ap numbers, E has no supportive function at all, and W can simply be scaled through cdr and large ap numbers rather than buying low budget items like Censor.

Like, you tell me: In a situation where I have a Yi and a Kayle, which one is stronger between a fully built Yi and a fully built Kayle with Kayle's ult on either of two hyper-scaling late game champs, or a Kayle with a Censor and a Knight's Vow for no reason at all? Which HONESTLY makes more sense?

1. Invade Yi. He's not exactly an early game god.
2. Snowball on Kayle. She's specing fully into support, so she can't really fight you. A couple jungle ganks pre-6 can absolutely destroy her. Just be careful of Yi counterganking.
3. Get all your lanes snowballing while Yi is farming his bloodrazor. So they get top tower. So what? If the games 9-1 in your favor, it straight up doesn't matter.
4. Teemo.
5. Lane Swap when Yi comes online. One man can't hold them off. Two people might. The support in particular works great, with their kits generally being great against Yi. Exhaust reduces his damage by a lot even if he's immune to the slow, and ignite cuts through all that healing.

The strat is meant to punish uncoordinated teams. If you are jgler, focus completely on bot once the strat starts. Also invading and trying to stop Yi helps as well. If you are a toplaner, I'd say the best option is to straight up abandon your lane and go bot to push towers once they start diving you, even if you get flamed by your team. Its basically a race to get to the nexus at this point and 5 people are likely to beat 2 people.
